abstract_summ: SARS-CoV and MERSCoV are particularly pathogenic in humans and are associated with high mortality . In this review, the epidemiology, pathophysiology, and management of the recently discovered COVID-19 are reviewed . This review analyzes the best information from the early research, including epidemiologic and demographic features from SARS and MersCoV viruses . As the pandemic sweeps the United States, lessons learned from early centers of infection can help localities to prepare .
